item.title: Weird giant head glitch
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“1 2 3 4 KOED, post:4, topic:542379”]Replace case 75 with this (Client.java)

case 75:
int j3 = inStream.method436();
int j11 = inStream.method436();
RSInterface.interfaceCache[j11].disabledMediaType = 2;
RSInterface.interfaceCache[j11].disabledMediaID = j3;
pktType = -1;
return true;[/quote]

My client does not have the variables “disabledMediaType” and “disabledMediaID”.

I’d also like to tell you that I’m very grateful to have you help me.

and this is what that case looked like before:

int j3 = inStream.method436(); int j11 = inStream.method436(); RSInterface.interfaceCache[j11].anInt233 = 2; RSInterface.interfaceCache[j11].mediaID = j3; pktType = -1; return true;

Read full topic

replace case 200 with this (Client.java)

case 200:
int l8 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
int i15 = inStream.readSignedWord();
RSInterface class9_4 = RSInterface.interfaceCache[l8];
class9_4.anInt257 = i15;
/*

  • if(l8 == 591 || l8 == 588 || l8 == 974 || l8 == 4883 || l8 ==
    1. { class9_4.modelZoom = 2000; }
      */
      if (i15 == 591 || i15 == 588) {
      class9_4.modelZoom = 2000; // anInt269
      }
      if (i15 == -1) {
      class9_4.anInt246 = 0;
      class9_4.anInt208 = 0;
      }
      pkttype = -1;
      return true;

item.title: Weird giant head glitch
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

So I’ve been working on getting Tutorial Island into my server and I came across this (note that it is animated)

More Info: This strange thing happens only on certain NPC’s and also only in the methods sendNpcChat1, sendNpcChat2, and rarely, sendNpcChat4. So far sendNpcChat3 is bug free.

Here’s the code for displaying the dialogue head (and dialogue) onto the chat box interface. I checked with my other server which is of the same revision but it’s base is RuneSource, they both seem to have the same exact values and both this server and my RuneSource server use the same cache. So wtf is up?

[code=java5]public static void sendNpcChat1(Client c,String s, int ChatNpc, String name) {
c.getPA().sendFrame200(4883, 591);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(name, 4884);
c.getPA().sendFrame126(s, 4885);
c.getPA().sendFrame75(ChatNpc, 4883);
c.getPA().sendFrame164(4882);
}

public static void sendNpcChat2(Client c,String s, String s1, int ChatNpc, String name) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame200(4888, 591);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(name, 4889);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s, 4890);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s1, 4891);
	c.getPA().sendFrame75(ChatNpc, 4888);
	c.getPA().sendFrame164(4887);
}

public static void sendNpcChat3(Client c,String s, String s1, String s2, int ChatNpc, String name) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame200(4894, 591);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(name, 4895);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s, 4896);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s1, 4897);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s2, 4898);
	c.getPA().sendFrame75(ChatNpc, 4894);
	c.getPA().sendFrame164(4893);
}
public static void sendNpcChat4(Client c,String s, String s1, String s2, String s3, int ChatNpc, String name) {
	c.getPA().sendFrame200(4901, 591);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(name, 4902);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s, 4903);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s1, 4904);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s2, 4905);
	c.getPA().sendFrame126(s3, 4906);
	c.getPA().sendFrame75(ChatNpc, 4901);
	c.getPA().sendFrame164(4900);
}[/code]

Read full topic
